Package mining

Class Cluster

java.lang.Object
mining.Cluster
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Cluster extends Object implements Serializable
The 'Cluster' class represents a cluster of centroids and contains methods for computing the centroid, adding and removing data centroids, and generating a string representation of the cluster.
See Also:

  • Method Details

    • getCentroid

      public Tuple getCentroid()
      The function returns a Tuple representing the centroid.
      Returns:
      A tuple representing the centroid.

    • computeCentroid

      public void computeCentroid(Data data)
      This function updates the centroid of a cluster based on the data and clustered data.
      Parameters:
      data - The 'data' parameter is an object of the 'Data' class, which likely contains a set of examples that are being used to compute the centroid.

    • addData

      public boolean addData(int id)
      The function adds an integer ID to a collection of clustered data and returns a boolean indicating if the operation was successful.
      Parameters:
      id - The parameter "id" is an integer value that represents the index of the example to be added into the "clusteredData" collection. The method returns a boolean value indicating if the operation successful or not.
      Returns:
      A boolean value, the result of the 'add' method being called on the 'clusteredData' object with the 'id' parameter passed as an argument.

    • contain

      public boolean contain(int id)
      The function checks if a given ID is contained in a clustered data structure and returns a boolean value.
      Parameters:
      id - The parameter "id" is an integer value that represents the identifier of the example that we want to check if it exists in the "clusteredData" collection. The method "contains" returns a boolean value indicating if the "clusteredData" collection contains the specified "id"
      Returns:
      A boolean value indicating if the integer parameter 'id' is contained in the 'clusteredData' set.

    • removeTuple

      public void removeTuple(int id)
      This function removes a tuple from a clustered data structure based on its ID.
      Parameters:
      id - The parameter "id" is an integer value that represents the identifier of the tuple that needs to be removed from the "clusteredData" collection.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      This function returns a string representation of the centroid.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      A string representation of the centroid, which includes the distinct values of the centroid

    • toString

      public String toString(Data data)
      The function returns a string representation of the centroid and examples in a given data set.
      Parameters:
      data - The input data that contains the examples to be clustered.
      Returns:
      A string representation of the data, including the centroid and examples with their distances from the centroid and average distance.
